intro: Diplycosia lavandulifolia, commonly known as the lavenderleaf dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves that resemble those of lavender. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to native gardens. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in Australian flora.
